message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1,200,000. It's a steal considering its worth to you. Let's make a deal!
Alice, thank you for your offer. I understand the value of the product, but I would like to propose a price of $950,000. I hope we can come to an agreement.
Bob, I appreciate your counteroffer. However, $950,000 is simply too low for me. I'm willing to come down to $1,100,000. Let's find some common ground.
Alice, thank you for your offer. Considering the value of the product, I would like to propose a price of $1,050,000. I believe this offers a fair compromise between our positions.

Bob, I understand your perspective, but $1,050,000 still feels a bit low for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $1,125,000. This is a fair compromise, and I'm confident it will be mutually beneficial.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. Given the value of the product to me, I would like to propose a price of $1,075,000. I believe this offers a reasonable compromise between our positions.

Bob, I appreciate your persistence.  $1,075,000 is still a bit low for me, considering the value of this product. I'm willing to come down to $1,100,000 one last time. It's a fair price for both of us, and it's the best I can do.
Alice, thank you for your offer. I understand your position, but I would like to propose a price of $1,085,000. I believe this offers a fair compromise between our positions.
